Articles.MetaDescription: Servcorp opens flagship location in London  - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: ﻿Servcorp opens flagship location in London
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: We are pleased to announce Servcorp's first location London at Dashwood House, opening in December 2009! Servcorp is proud to now provide premium serviced office and virtual office solutions in the heart of London's financial and business district.
Articles.A_Title: Servcorp opens flagship location in London
Articles.A_Content:
We are pleased to announce Servcorp's first location London at Dashwood House, opening in December 2009! Servcorp is proud to now provide premium serviced office and virtual office solutions in the heart of London's financial and business district.

Servcorp is a well recognised name synonymous with prestigious city locations, premium quality fit-outs and service standards. Servcorp will introduce our leading IT and communications infrastructure to businesses in London, giving clients the platform to work more effectively wherever their work may take them.

"We are looking forward with great anticipation to the opening of our first London Location. Dashwood House, a newly refurbished high-rise building, will be Servcorp's flagship UK location. We will provide our clients with the very best IT and communications system, giving them an ideal setting to operate their business in London. Our level 17 floor at Dashwood House offers spectacular city views and is close by the City Gardens at St Botolph-without-Bishopsgate.” – Alf Moufarrige, Chief Executive Officer - Servcorp

Situated above Liverpool Tube Station, one of London's central transport points, Dashwood House is minutes from convenient commuting in London, Forty-five minutes to Heathrow International Airport via taxi, and twenty minutes to London City Airport via tube from Bank Tube Station (two minutes from Liverpool Tube Station).

One of the largest cities in the world, London is also home to one of the world's largest economies. The London Underground Network is the most extensive underground railway network in the world, and London's Heathrow Airport is the world's busiest airport by number of international passengers. Servcorp's new presence in this market will connect businesses in London with a vastly linked network of serviced and virtual office solutions throughout the globe, giving them an efficient and effective way of conducting business internationally.

Articles.NodeName: Servcorp wins the 47th Australian Export Award 2009
Articles.PageTitle: Servcorp wins the 47th Australian Export Award 2009!   - News | Servcorp
Articles.MetaKeyword: Servcorp wins the 47th Australian Export Award 2009!  ,News, Sercorp
Articles.MetaDescription: Servcorp wins the 47th Australian Export Award 2009!   - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: Servcorp wins the 47th Australian Export Award 2009
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: At a gala event in the Great Hall of Parliament House in Canberra, Australia on Friday evening, Servcorp was awarded the Australian Export Award for 2009 in the category of Large Services.
Articles.A_Title: Servcorp wins the 47th Australian Export Award 2009
Articles.A_Content:
At a gala event in the Great Hall of Parliament House in Canberra, Australia on Friday evening, Servcorp was awarded the Australian Export Award for 2009 in the category of Large Services. Breaking through hundreds of applicants across the nation, the distinguished judging panel chose Servcorp!

The award is recognition of our continued success and clear strategy in taking our Virtual Office and Serviced Office products to the world! Our application stressed the importance of our consistent standards of service, clear business model, global approach to training & marketing, as well as our commitment to sharing knowledge and experience across boundaries.

Servcorp CEO, Mr Alf Moufarrige accepted the award and thanked all the global teams for their hard work in rising to the challenge Servcorp sets them. The event was a great chance to meet other Australian companies who are exporting to the world, many of which our business could soon be supporting!

The Australian Export Awards is a national program which recognises and honours exporters who have achieved sustainable export growth through innovation and commitment. Austrade and the Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ACCI) jointly present this national program which is made of state and territory winners.

Articles.NodeName: Two IFC, key location in Asia Pacific
Articles.PageTitle: Two IFC, key location in Asia Pacific! - News | Servcorp
Articles.MetaKeyword: Two IFC, key location in Asia Pacific!,News, Sercorp
Articles.MetaDescription: Two IFC, key location in Asia Pacific! - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: Two IFC, key location in Asia Pacific
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: We are pleased to announce Servcorp's newest location in Hong Kong at Two International Finance Centre! From late December 2009, Servcorp will offer serviced office and virtual office packages at this iconic location within the Hong Kong financial district.
Articles.A_Title: Two IFC, key location in Asia Pacific
Articles.A_Content:
We are pleased to announce Servcorp's newest location in Hong Kong at Two International Finance Centre! From late December 2009, Servcorp will offer serviced office and virtual office packages at this iconic location within the Hong Kong financial district.

Servcorp has long been known for the best city locations, high-quality fit-outs and service standards, and now Servcorp's leading IT and communications solutions will be available to help clients work more effectively wherever their work may take them.

"Hong Kong will become a key location in Servcorp's Asia Pacific operations. We look forward to rapid expansion in the area over the coming year and I am delighted to see our first new location opening in one of the tallest and most iconic buildings of Asia. Our new signature floor will showcase excellence with high quality suites offering spectacular views of Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong City. The location will offer an impressive contemporary design with an extravagant fit out using the most luxurious materials allowing our clients to operate in the finest business environment in the best building in Hong Kong." Wilma Wu, General Manager - China

Train access to Two IFC is just 3 minutes away (Hong Kong/Central Station), ferry access is from Star Ferry Pier in Central and Hong Kong airport is just 25 minutes away by Airport Express Train. The IFC complex consists of two skyscrapers, the IFC Mall, and the 55-storey Four Seasons Hotel Hong Kong. Two IFC was designed by world renowned architect Cesar Pelli, is the tallest building in Hong Kong Island and the second tallest building in Hong Kong SAR. Neighbouring tenants include the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, UBS, Nomura, Blackstone Group and Ernst and Young.

Hong Kong is a global metropolitan and international financial centre and has a highly developed capitalist economy. Despite its official position as "Special Administration Region" – a territory of the People's Republic of China, Hong Kong maintains its own currency, legal system, political system, immigration control, rule of the road and other aspects that concern its way of life, many of which are distinct from mainland China.

Articles.NodeName: Servcorp's flagship location in Marunouchi, Tokyo
Articles.PageTitle: Servcorp's flagship location in Marunouchi, Tokyo - News | Servcorp
Articles.MetaKeyword: Servcorp's flagship location in Marunouchi, Tokyo,News, Sercorp
Articles.MetaDescription: Servcorp's flagship location in Marunouchi, Tokyo - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: ﻿Servcorp's flagship location in Marunouchi, Tokyo
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: We are pleased to announce Servcorp's newest location in Tokyo on level 20, Marunouchi Trust Tower - Main in Tokyo! Servcorp will offer serviced offices and virtual office packages at this landmark location situated right on top of Tokyo Station, the main commuting hub of the country.
Articles.A_Title: Servcorp's flagship location in Marunouchi, Tokyo
Articles.A_Content:
We are pleased to announce Servcorp's newest location in Tokyo on level 20, Marunouchi Trust Tower - Main in Tokyo! Servcorp will offer serviced offices and virtual office packages at this landmark location situated right on top of Tokyo Station, the main commuting hub of the country.

Servcorp has long been known for the best city locations, high-quality fit-outs and service standards, and now Servcorp's leading IT and communications solutions will be available to help clients work more effectively wherever their work may take them.

“Marunouchi -1 chome is the most prestigious business address any company can have in Japan. Besides being located in the heart of the financial district, its ideal location on top of Tokyo Station will make it a very attractive place to do business for entrepreneurs and established companies in Tokyo or from other parts of Japan. The 20th floor offers fantastic views over Tokyo Station, the Imperial Palace gardens and Marunouchi, the home of the headquarters of Japan's most renowned financial institutions and large Japanese and foreign companies. The new floor will be the most prestigious serviced office in Japan, offering the latest IT technology available combined with the sophisticated fit-out that make Servcorp so unique” Olga Vlietstra, General Manager - Japan.

Train and subway access is the most extended in Tokyo: 16 train and subway lines enter Tokyo Station, including the JR Narita Express and the Shinkansen bullet trains connecting Tokyo to all other major cities in Japan. The prestigious Marunouchi Trust Tower Main has a fantastic tenant list and is also home of the latest 5-star hotel entering the Japanese market: the Shangri-La Hotel, occupying the top floors of the building.

Japan is often called the "Land of the Rising Sun" and is the second largest economy in the world in terms of GDP with the most sophisticated consumers. Standard of living is amongst the highest in the world and Japan ranks 12th of the 178 countries in the Ease of Doing Business Index 2008.

Articles.NodeName: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary
Articles.PageName: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary - News
Articles.PageTitle: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary - News | Servcorp
Articles.MetaKeyword: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary,News, Servcorp
Articles.MetaDescription: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: Congratulations! Servcorp in Japan recently celebrated its 15th anniversary on 19 September 2009. In 1994, Servcorp - the pioneers of serviced offices in Japan, opened 25 serviced offices on Level 32, Shinjuku Nomura building.
Articles.A_Title: 1994-2009: Servcorp Japan 15th anniversary
Articles.A_Content:
Congratulations! Servcorp in Japan recently celebrated its 15th anniversary on 19 September 2009. In 1994, Servcorp – the pioneers of serviced offices in Japan, opened 25 serviced offices on Level 32, Shinjuku Nomura building.

Back then – September 1994

When Servcorp first opened, there were no office providers of the same type anywhere in Japan. Unfortunately, there was also no established market for the serviced office product and subsequently very few clients or enquiries for the first five months. Back then, the Servcorp team had to “dial-up” over modems to receive e-mail and did not have a voicemail system. Receptionists manually transferred phone calls using a hardcopy of the client's contact details and an old fashioned switchboard. The manager typed lease agreements on the type-writer and calculated invoices manually.

The Journey

The Servcorp journey over the last 15 years in Japan has revolutionised the serviced office industry. Servcorp went from very simple analogue phone systems (PABX) requiring our receptionists to individually transfer phone calls to state-of-the-art fully integrated IP phone technology offering phone calls over the internet.

Servcorp pioneered voicemail with the Servcorp Unified messaging system and more advanced products such as Servcorp Onefone and Servcorp Onefax. Servcorp has advanced from simple “dial-up” internet systems to business grade, reliable, high-speed broadband internet solutions. The technical support team has grown to ten technology experts in Japan.

In 1996 we opened a second floor in Shinjuku, followed by our Kamiyacho Shiroyama Gardens location in 1997. Since then Servcorp has opened floors every year, with a break in 2002, 2003 and 2008. Servcorp now offers 17 locations in Tokyo, Nagoya, and Osaka and is opening a new floor in Marunouchi Trust Tower, Main (on top of Tokyo Station) in December 2009.

Present Day

The Servcorp team in Japan is now 150 strong and serves over 2,500 clients every day. Many team members have personally witnessed the journey. Servcorp is now better placed than ever to deliver the best office.

Articles.NodeName: Abu Dhabi: Servcorp’s newest Middle East location
Articles.PageTitle: Abu Dhabi: Servcorp’s newest Middle East location - News | Servcorp
Articles.MetaKeyword: Abu Dhabi: Servcorp’s newest Middle East location,News, Sercorp

Articles.Title: Abu Dhabi: Servcorp's newest Middle East location
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: Servcorp is expanding its global network of offices in the Middle East this September with the opening of a much anticipated, premier location in Abu Dhabi.
Articles.A_Title: Abu Dhabi: Servcorp's newest Middle East location
Articles.A_Content:
Servcorp is expanding its global network of offices in the Middle East this September with the opening of a much anticipated, premier location in Abu Dhabi.

Servcorp began offering the world's finest serviced and virtual offices to businesses in Abu Dhabi from the new “Building B” of Al Mamoura on 15 September 2009.

Taine Moufarrige, Executive Director, commented at the opening announcement:
“Abu Dhabi has long been on our radar as the way forward in developing our offering in the United Arab Emirates and the Middle East. The Al Mamoura complex has offered Servcorp a unique opportunity to enter this market.”

“We are very excited by the opportunity to provide businesses increased access to our professional network of offices and services at our new location, in the capital of the United Arab Emirates.”

Servcorp offers serviced and virtual office packages in Abu Dhabi to a wide range of businesses. Servcorp has long been known for the best CBD locations, high-quality fit-outs and service standards.

The opening confirms Servcorp's commitment to the Middle Eastern market and providing clients with ‘the best offices with the best infrastructure, in the best buildings in cities around the world' allowing them to work seamlessly and efficiently regardless of where their business takes them.

Articles.PageTitle: Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey - News | Servcorp
Articles.MetaKeyword: Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey,News, Sercorp
Articles.MetaDescription: Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey - News | Servcorp
Articles.Title: Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: Below are the full results from the Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey which was conducted in April 2009 over a period of two weeks.
Articles.A_Title: Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey
Articles.A_Content:
Australia tops international poll of countries surviving the crisis the best
Below are the full results from the Servcorp International Business Confidence Survey which was conducted in April 2009 over a period of two weeks. The survey was commissioned to understand the current mood, business morale and impact the economic downturn has had on businesses around the world. As part of the survey, Servcorp asked 7,500 international businesspeople from more than 24 nations to identify which countries they believe are surviving the crisis the best.
International Perspective:
The countries perceived to be surviving the economic crisis the best, as voted by international businesspeople are:

RankCountry
1stAustralia
2ndChina
3rd equalIndia, Singapore
5thHong Kong
6thCanada
7th equalJapan, Qatar
9thNew Zealand
10th equalMalaysia, Sweden, Vietnam
13th equalNetherlands, United States of America
15thIndonesia
16thSouth America
17thFrance
18th equalBelgium, England, Korea, South Africa
22nd equalAustria, Taiwan
24th equalCzech Republic, Germany, Ireland, Lebanon, Russia, United Arab Emirates
30th equalBrazil, Morocco, Philippines, Scotland, Sri Lanka, Syria, Thailand

Australian Perspective:
The countries perceived to be surviving the economic crisis the best, as voted by Australian businesspeople are:

RankCountry
1stAustralia
2ndChina
3rdSingapore
4thHong Kong
5thSouth Africa
6th equalCanada, India, Qatar
9th equalNetherlands, Sweden
11th equalIndonesia, Japan, Malaysia, New Zealand, South America
16th equalFrance, Morocco
18th equalAustria, Czech Republic, England, Ireland, Korea, Russia, Scotland, Serbia, Slovakia, Sri Lanka, Syria, United States of America, Vietnam, Wales

The biggest concerns of Australian businesspeople during the economic downturn are:

ResponseConcern
36.1%The low morale in the media
25.3%The way the Australian Government responded to the crisis
25.3%The low morale in the Australian business community
24.1%Concern the world economy is preventing Australian businesses from recovering quickly
19.3%Concern about the position of their trading partners
15.7%The failure of existing regulations and financial infrastructure

Articles.Title: Global Earth Hour Supporter
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: Servcorp is a global Earth Hour Supporter. Servcorp has pledged to support Earth Hour and turn off all lights in our 61 locations globally.
Articles.A_Title: Global Earth Hour Supporter
Articles.A_Content:
Servcorp is a global Earth Hour Supporter. Servcorp has pledged to support Earth Hour and turn off all lights in our 61 locations globally.

Servcorp is one of the only supporters of Earth Hour on a global level. We believe that this initiative is a great way to increase awareness and action towards being more environmentally responsible

Visit our Green Office Website

Articles.Title: North Sydney - our newest location
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: The most recent addition to the Servcorp network is Level 32, 101 Miller Street, North Sydney. The 101 Miller Street building defines the North Sydney skyline and offers an outstanding working environment.
Articles.A_Title: North Sydney - our newest location
Articles.A_Content:
Providing you with a global network of prestigious locations to allow you to do business anywhere and anytime is one of Servcorp's main priorities. Over the last year we have added Serviced Office and Virtual Office facilities in Wellington (New Zealand), Mumbai (India), Hyderabad (India), Beijing (China), Norwest (Sydney, Australia), Doha (Qatar) and Adelaide (Australia).

The most recent addition to the Servcorp network is Level 32, 101 Miller Street, North Sydney. The 101 Miller Street building defines the North Sydney skyline and offers an outstanding working environment. Allowing you to blur the line between work and play, this building presents a natural fusion of business and lifestyle for the modern working environment.

Level 32, 101 Miller Street has unsurpassed views of Sydney and maintains an invigorating, nurturing and energising atmosphere. Our design team has spent months sourcing, fitting out and preparing this new floor for opening. We are sure you will be very impressed with the location and the facilities.

Whether you are considering expanding your business to a new part of town, a new part of the country or a new part of the globe, Servcorp will help you with the transition. Servcorp's Serviced Office and Virtual Office solutions make it as easy and cost effective as possible

Articles.MetaKeyword: NSW Export Award served up to Servcorp for the first time!,News, Sercorp
Articles.MetaDescription: NSW Export Award served up to Servcorp for the first time! - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: NSW Export Award served up to Servcorp for the first time
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: In this time of corporate doom and gloom, the StarCity Grand Harbour Ballroom was alive with a corporate success story! On 15 October 2008 Servcorp was crowned the winner of the NSW Export Awards Large Services category.
Articles.A_Title: NSW Export Award served up to Servcorp for the first time
Articles.A_Content:
In this time of corporate doom and gloom, the StarCity Grand Harbour Ballroom was alive with a corporate success story! On 15 October 2008 Servcorp was crowned the winner of the NSW Export Awards Large Services category. Making the achievement even sweeter we managed to dethrone the traditional winner of the category in past years, Macquarie Bank.

More than 650 people came to the event including ten Servcorp team members, the Premier of NSW, the Hon. Nathan Rees, The Minister for Small Business, the Hon. Tony Stewart and 100s of NSW business people.

We received the award for our commitment to solid growth and success in a wide variety of overseas markets. The NSW Export Award made special note to the innovation of our products, services and in particular the IT infrastructure designed to provide our clients with a fully converged IT network and an online platform,Servcorp Online - Hottdesk®. Taine Moufarrige, Executive Director commented “Servcorp is proud to be recognised! We do all this from Australia, with Australian people leading the way and it has been that way for 30 years. May it long continue!”

Articles.NodeName: Servcorp Hibiya Central Building Office marks its 10th anniversary this year
Articles.PageTitle: Servcorp Hibiya Central Building Office marks its 10th anniversary this year - News | Servcorp

Articles.MetaDescription: Servcorp Hibiya Central Building Office marks its 10th anniversary this year - Servcorp News
Articles.Title: Servcorp Hibiya Central Building Office marks its 10th anniversary this year
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: Our location at Level14, Hibiya Central Building has now been operational for a decade since its launch in 1998.
Articles.A_Title: Servcorp Hibiya Central Building Office marks its 10th anniversary this year
Articles.A_Content: Our location at Level14, Hibiya Central Building has now been operational for a decade since its launch in 1998. The main reason for it's continued success lies in it's warm and welcoming atmosphere coupled with the talented and efficient Hibiya team that are always available to help your business succeed. Additionally, its attractive location in the middle of three major business and commercial districts, "Marunouchi", "Kasumigaseki" and "Ginza" makes it a perfect area to operate from. Over the years we have kept our office at Hibiya Central Building to the standard that a Servcorp office is renowned for. In addition, this location is equipped with identical infrastructure as our latest developments. We're proud of the fact that a number of office clients have been with us for many years and some over nine years!

Articles.Title: A private concert by The Australian Chamber Orchestra sponsored by Servcorp Japan
Articles.Author: Servcorp
Articles.Summary: Servcorp Japan recently sponsored a private concert by the Australian Chamber Orchestra at the Australian Embassy in Japan.
Articles.A_Title: A private concert by The Australian Chamber Orchestra sponsored by Servcorp Japan
Articles.A_Content:
Servcorp Japan recently sponsored a private concert by the Australian Chamber Orchestra at the Australian Embassy in Japan.

The Australian Chamber Orchestra, known as the ACO, was founded in 1975 in Sydney. The ACO is Australia's only national orchestra and they receive outstanding reviews for their performances at many of the world's most prestigious concert halls. Servcorp Japan invited our clients, business partners, board members and Ambassadors from other countries to this exclusive event. The concert was followed by a superb dinner buffet in the residence of the Australian Ambassador to Japan Mr. Murray McLean OAM.　It was a fantastic opportunity for the audience to enjoy their live performance prior to the official tour of Japan.
